description: Variation of condition 2 (approved plans) of listed building consent 2021/1564 dated 28/09/2021 for the external repairs. The effect of variation would be the addition of new detailing and installation of a dwarf wall along the eastern boundary.
decision_conditions: <p>Full details, including physical samples for inspection on site, of all the materials to be used on the external surfaces of the building, including, but not limited to:</p><p>a) 1 metre square sample panels showing the proposed pointing joints, mortar mix, profile and finish (which shall be slightly (2-3mm) recessed from the arrises and not weatherstruck, ribbon or bucket handle pointing;</p><p>b) all new and replacement bricks;</p><p>c) all new and replacement clay roof and hip tiles;</p><p>d) all new and replacement leadwork;</p><p>e) all new and replacement coping stones, stone repairs and stone cills; all new and replacement railings.</p><p>Shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, in writing, before the start of the relevant part of the works. The works shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that those features which contribute to the special architectural and historic interest of the building are retained.</p>

<p>No new grilles, satellite dishes, aerials, meter boxes, security alarms, lighting, security or other cameras or other fixtures or plant shall be mounted on the external faces or roof of the building other than those shown on the drawings hereby approved.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that those features which contribute to the special architectural and historic interest of the building are retained.</p>

<p>No soil stacks, soil vent pipes, plumbing, pipes, flues, vents or ductwork shall be fixed on the external faces of the building other than those shown on the drawings hereby approved.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that those features which contribute to the special architectural and historic interest of the building are retained.</p>

<p>All new and replacement external rainwater and soil pipes shall be of traditional design, formed in cast iron and painted black.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that those features which contribute to the special architectural and historic interest of the building are retained.</p>

<p>All new works, and works of making good to the retained fabric, whether internal or external, shall be finished to match the original work with regard to the methods used and to material, dimensions, composition, form, colour, finish and profile, and in the case of brickwork, facebond and pointing.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that those features which contribute to the special architectural and historic interest of the building are retained.</p>

<p>No cleaning of masonry, other than low pressure (20-100 psi) surface cleaning using a nebulous water spray is authorised by this consent without the prior approval of the Local Planning Authority.&nbsp; Before work begins, any other cleaning proposals must be approved in writing and carried out strictly in accordance with those details.&nbsp; At the commencement of the cleaning, a test panel shall be undertaken in an inconspicuous position and the method recorded to the approval of the Local Planning Authority.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that those features which contribute to the special architectural and historic interest of the building are retained.</p>

The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with 28/09/2021.


REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of Section 18(a) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 as amended.

The development hereby permitted shall only be carried out and completed strictly in accordance with the submitted plans hereby approved and any subsequent approval of details.


REASON: To ensure that the development hereby permitted is carried out in full accordance with the plans hereby approved.
